--- title: "3.3 — Entry Deterrence and Commitment — Class Content" execute: freeze: auto --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance=minimal} # Meeting Date *Tuesday, March 21, 2023* ::: ## Overview Today we discuss entry deterrence, entry games, subgame perfection, and commitments in game theory. ## Readings - Ch. 9, 13, 14 in [Church & Ware, 2000](https://works.bepress.com/jeffrey_church/23/) Chapter 9 covers sequential games, games in extensive form, subgames, and subgame perfection. Chapter 13 covers strategic behavior, limit output/pricing, and entry deterrence. Chapter 14 gives more detailed models of entry deterrence and contestable markets. ## Slides Below, you can find the slides in two formats. Clicking the image will bring you to the html version of the slides in a new tab. The lower button will allow you to download a PDF version of the slides. ::: callout-tip You can type h to see a special list of viewing options, and type o for an outline view of all the slides. ::: I suggest printing the slides beforehand and using them to take additional notes in class (*not everything* is in the slides)!

Download as PDF
